meanings.definition: Not one or the other of two people or things
meanings.sent1: She liked neither dress, so she decided not to buy any.
meanings.sent2: I could find neither my keys nor my phone in the house.
meanings.sent3: The cat was neither black nor white, but a mix of both colors.
meanings.sent4: His answer was neither here nor there, completely off-topic.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant served neither hot nor cold soup, just lukewarm.

meanings.definition: Not either of two things or people
meanings.sent1: Neither option seemed appealing to her, so she chose to do nothing.
meanings.sent2: He was neither happy nor sad about the news, just indifferent.
meanings.sent3: The cake was neither chocolate nor vanilla, but a unique flavor.
meanings.sent4: The road was neither straight nor curved, but had a slight bend.
meanings.sent5: The weather was neither sunny nor rainy, just overcast and gloomy.

meanings.definition: Used before the first of two or more alternatives that are being specified
meanings.sent1: Neither cat liked the new toy, but they both loved the box it came in.
meanings.sent2: Neither student knew the answer to the question, so the teacher explained it.
meanings.sent3: The store had neither red nor blue shirts, only green ones.
meanings.sent4: Neither parent could attend the meeting, so they sent their apologies.
meanings.sent5: Neither sibling wanted to share the last cookie, so they split it in half.

meanings.definition: Used to introduce a further negative statement
meanings.sent1: I don't like coffee, and neither do I enjoy tea.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to go out, and neither did her friends.
meanings.sent3: He didn't like spicy food, and neither did his brother.
meanings.sent4: The movie wasn't interesting, and neither was the book.
meanings.sent5: They didn't win the game, and neither did they score any points.
